meanings.definition: A row or line of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers stood in ranks during the parade.
meanings.sent2: The students lined up in ranks for the school assembly.
meanings.sent3: The ranks of colorful flowers in the garden looked like a rainbow.
meanings.sent4: The ranks of books on the shelf seemed to be having a meeting.
meanings.sent5: The ranks of trees along the path created a beautiful natural corridor.

meanings.sent1: She quickly rose through the ranks to become a manager.
meanings.sent2: The CEO held the highest rank in the company.
meanings.sent3: In the world of insects, the ant queen holds the highest rank.
meanings.sent4: The rank of captain in the army carries great responsibility.
meanings.sent5: His dedication earned him a high rank in the organization.

meanings.definition: To arrange in a row or line.
meanings.sent1: She ranks the books on the shelf by genre.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to rank themselves in order of height.
meanings.sent3: He decided to rank his collection of stamps from smallest to largest.
meanings.sent4: The chef carefully ranked the spices in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The librarian will rank the new books on the shelves tomorrow.

meanings.definition: To have a particular position in a hierarchy.
meanings.sent1: He ranks as the top scorer in the basketball team.
meanings.sent2: The professor ranks among the most respected in the university.
meanings.sent3: The cat thinks it ranks higher than the dog in the household hierarchy.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work ranks with the best in the gallery.
meanings.sent5: Her performance ranks as one of the finest in the history of the theater.
